alert.note: Alert for Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand and Battlement Mesas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 28 at 1:39AM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Colorado... Plateau Creek near Cameo affecting Debeque to Silt Corridor and Grand and Battlement Mesas. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. In addition, Vega Reservoir is expected to reach full capacity, utilizing the overflow spillway, which will increase flow down Plateau Creek.
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those recreating along or near the creek should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. COZ007-009-300745- /O.CON.KGJT.FL.A.0004.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /PCCC2.0.MC.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NR/ 139 AM MDT Sun May 28 2023 ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Plateau Creek from Collbran to the confluence with the Colorado River near Cameo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Water will approach homes in the low-lying areas adjacent to Plateau Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Debeque to Silt Corridor; Grand and Battlement Mesas
